alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Delaware; Otsego; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 14 at 9:58PM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible, along with a possible wintry mix. Total snow accumulations of 7 inches or more is possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Travel Sunday night and Monday could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to the bitterly cold wind chills overnight, temperatures on Saturday are expected to stay in the single digits above zero and then quickly fall back well below zero overnight Saturday night. This will be a prolonged period under very cold conditions. This could lead to pipes freezing.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Brings pets and other animals inside to protect them from the cold. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
